sanskrit_verse:
यथोक्तान्यपि कर्माणि परिहाय द्विजोत्तमः ।
आत्मज्ञाने शमे च स्याद्वेदाभ्यासे च यत्नवान् ॥ १२.९२॥
transliteration: yathoktānyapi karmāṇi parihāya dvijottamaḥ | ātmajñāne śame ca syādvedābhyāse ca yatnavān || 12.92||
sph_interpretive_translation: The highest among the twice-born, having abandoned all actions as previously instructed, shall engage with effort in Self-knowledge, tranquility, and the study of the Vedas.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from realized consciousness, not ritual status
Causation is rooted in alignment with Vedic knowing and inner stillness
Capacity-based responsibility requires graduated renunciation before Self-engagement
Restoration logic prioritizes spiritual maturation over external compliance
Consciousness alignment supersedes performative dharmic duty
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent has completed prior action-based obligations THEN permit transition to knowledge-centered engagement
IF individual demonstrates capacity for internal regulation THEN reduce procedural oversight
IF conduct aligns with vedic study and self-reflection THEN classify as dharma-preserving behavior
IF dvija attains atmajnana readiness THEN authorize withdrawal from transactional karma
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving spiritual practitioners or brahminical subjects, the court must recognize graduated stages of dharma-readiness. Where a litigant demonstrates verified detachment from prior karmic roles and active pursuit of Self-knowledge, judicial process shall shift from regulatory control to facilitative support.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that true causality lies in consciousness transformation, not behavioral correction. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential unfolding: abandonment precedes integration. Proportional responsibility recognizes evolved capacity. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that alignment with Self-knowledge resolves all karmic dissonance without coercive intervention.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Formal acknowledgment and closure of previous ritual-action obligations
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Voluntary declaration of readiness for Self-centered engagement
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Structured access to vedic learning and meditative practices
Integrity Reintegration Framework: Verification through community witness of sustained śama-vrata
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Sanatana Dharma. Justice is executed through restoration of consciousness integrity, not imposition of punitive consequence. Reality itself adjudicates by awakening the Self.
